title: Russell Cave National Monument: Distance Learning
body: Distance Learning          Results   Showing results 1-1 of 1    Sort By:  Title Date         Russell Cave National Monument Trail of Tears Teacher's Workbook    Alabama played a much larger role in the removal of the Cherokee Indians from their homelands in the southeast than was previously thought. At least eight companies of heavily armed troops, including regular United States army soldiers, and Alabama and Tennessee volunteers, poured into Northeast Alabama to carry out the removal of the Cherokees, and some Creeks, as called for by terms of the Treaty of New Echota.    Type:Distance Learning Grade level:Fourth Grade-Twelfth Grade Subjects:American Indian History and Culture, Anthropology, Education, Environment, History
